columns.text: In this task, we are asked to prove the given statement.

The **Internal Growth Rate** is defined as the growth rate that a company can achieve through its financial resources without taking any external financing. As a result, the corporation relies completely on retained profits to keep operations running.

The **Sustainable Growth Rate** is the highest growth rate that a company is capable of achieving with no additional equity funding from outside sources while yet maintaining the same debt-to-equity ratio. A company's sustainable growth rate tells you where it is in its life cycle. Looking into the company's long-term growth rate will allow an investor to make an informed decision about whether or not to invest.

The internal growth rate is calculated in following way:

$$\begin{align*}
\text{IGR}&=\dfrac{\text{ROA}\cdot\text{b}}{1-(\text{ROA}\cdot\text{b})}
\end{align*}$$

Where:

IGR = Internal Growth Rate

ROA = Return On Assets

b = Retention Ratio

The sustainable growth rate is calculated in following way:

$$\begin{align*}
\text{SGR}=\dfrac{\text{b}\cdot\text{ROE}}{1-(\text{b}\cdot\text{ROE})}
\end{align*}$$

Where:

SGR = Sustainable Growth Rate

ROE = Return on Equity

b = Retention Ratio

Return on assets is calculated by dividing net income (NI) by total assets (A). Also from the previous task we have that net income is a product of profit margin (PM) and sales (S). Both formulas are shown below:

$$\begin{align*}
\text{ROA}&=\dfrac{\text{NI}}{\text{A}}\\[15pt]
\text{NI}&=\text{PS}(\text{S})
\end{align*}$$

Now we will substitute the return on assets equation into the equation for the internal growth rate (IGR) and divide both the numerator and denominator by A as follows:

$$\begin{align*}
\text{IGR}&=\dfrac{[\text{PM(S)b}]}{[\text{A-PM(S)b}]}\\[20pt]
&=\dfrac{\dfrac{[\text{PM(S)b}]}{\text{A}}}{\dfrac{[\text{A-PM(S)b}]}{\text{A}}}\\[30pt]
&=\dfrac{[\text{PM(S)b}]}{[\text{1-PM(S)b}]}\\[20pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{ROA}\cdot{\text{b}}}{1-\text{ROA}\cdot \text{b}}
\end{align*}$$

In conclusion, the internal growth rate equation is presented and proved to be equal to the original formula from step 4.

To determine the sustainable growth rate, we will use the equation to calculate the EFN from step 6 and refactor the equation as follows:

$$\begin{align*}
\text{EFN}&=-\text{PM(S)}\text{b}+[\text{A}-\text{PM(S)\text{b}}]\text{g}\\[10pt]
&=-\text{PM(S)}\text{b}+[\text{A(g)-}\text{PM(S)b}(\text{g})]\\[10pt]
&=\text{A(g)}-\text{PM(S)}\text{b}(1+\text{g})
\end{align*}$$

Now, we will substitute obtained formulas to, show that the sustainable growth rate equal to the original formula from step 5 as follows:

$$\begin{align*}
\text{SGR}&=\dfrac{[\text{PM(S)b(1+\text{g})}]}{[\text{A-PM(S)b(1+g)]}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{[ROA(1+g)b]}}{[1-\text{ROA(1+g)b]}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{b(ROE)}}{1-\text{b(ROE)}}
\end{align*}$$

In conclusion, the sustainable growth rate equation is presented and proven.
